    • Uses of InvalidNoteException in songApp

      Methods in songApp that throw InvalidNoteException 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void Song.playSong(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> notes)
      playSong method: creates a new piano to play the song and goes through the arraylist created from the readFile method and plays each note.
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> Song.readFile(java.lang.String filename)
      readFile method: used to go through the file and append it to an arraylist.

    • Uses of InvalidNoteException in utilities

      Methods in utilities that throw InvalidNoteException 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private void NoteADT.NoteValueCheck(int midiNoteValue) 
      Constructors in utilities that throw InvalidNoteException 
      Constructor and Description
      Note(double frequency)
      Note constructor -double Takes in a double frequency to create the note, see ADT for more information
      Note(int semitones)
      Note constructor -semitones Takes in the number of semitones above or below concert pitch to create the note, see ADT for more information
      Note(Note n)
      Note constructor, built specifically for the melody class, takes in a note and the halfsteps for the note.
      Note(java.lang.String strNote)
      Note constructor -semitones Takes in the number of semitones above or below concert pitch to create the note, see ADT for more information
      NoteADT(double frequency)
      The constructors for a note accept a frequency as a double for Hz or a number of semitones as an int above or below the concert pitch (440Hz) or a music note as a String such as C#4 Imperfect frequencies are tuned to the nearest half pitch Notes that are outside the range of 0 - 127 are invalid notes and the InvalidNoteException is raised.
      NoteADT(int semitones) 
      NoteADT(java.lang.String strNote)
